Posts.Content: Feb 27, 2014 01:28AM Ram2645 wrote: Thank you all sooo much.....will hang tight and update you when I have news.  Until then, my thoughts are with you all.....  :)
Posts.Title: Thank you all for being here Ram2645 SlowDeepBreaths

Posts.Content: Feb 28, 2014 03:48PM Ram2645 wrote: BENIGN !!!  It is in the end a fibroadenoma.  Although I tried not to worry I must admit I'm weak with relief.  Strength to all who are waiting and all who are coping with individual challenges in moving through BC.   Uncountable good wishes to all and thank you again for the wonderful support you and the site provide.
Posts.Title: Thank you all for being here Ram2645 SlowDeepBreaths

Posts.Content: Ram2645 wrote: Reading all your posts and advice has made a huge difference to me.  I am a 69 year old who yesterday had a second biopsy (core biopsy) because the first fine needle biopsy of February 15th did not get enough cells to enable diagnosis.  What I do know is that it is a miniscule (4mm) hard immovable nodule with uneven edges. Now I must be patient for another week......  I am trying to keep myself calm by reminding myself that even if malignant it is so tiny it is  curable..... but I must admit that now that the wait is longer than anticipated some hints of  apprehension are creeping in from time to time and the butterflies need to be tamped down from time to time....I find it difficult talking about it to friends and family because none have been through it and  do not want to worry anyone. Thank you all for being here and my thoughts are with all of you fighting your own challenges. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Thank you all for being here Ram2645 SlowDeepBreaths
